intro: Plesioneuron imbricatum, commonly known as the rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that often grow in dense mats on rocky surfaces. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually small, with a leathery texture and a distinctive, overlapping arrangement. Plesioneuron imbricatum plays an important ecological role in maintaining microhabitats for various invertebrates and mosses.
